ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The time the task was started on a 24 clock
Assigned group ID number
Session number
Block Number
Trial number
The minimum amount of correct trials needed before moving onto the next rule or block
The maximum number of trials presented before moving onto the next block or rule
The probability of being rewarded if selecting the correct response
A counter which marks how many blocks were displayed
A counter which marks how many trials were displayed in each block
Which description is the rule
Notes: triangle, yellow, turquoise, square, circle, magenta

ElementDescription: Which description was the rule directly previous to the new rule
Notes: triangle, yellow, turquoise, square, circle, magenta

ElementDescription: Whether a reward was received on the current trial
Cumulative rewards up to that trial
The image for the stimulus: Shape 1
Shape 1 Color
Shape 1 Shape
Shape 1 Location on the screen
The image for the stimulus: Shape 2
Shape 2 Color
Shape 2 Shape
Shape 2 Location on the screen
The image for the stimulus: Shape 3
Shape 3 Color
Shape 3 Shape
Shape 3 Location on the screen
Response
Was the judgment correct or incorrect
Latency
